title: Wait, Gap's Pre–Black Friday Sale Is So Good—25 Elevated Winter Basics That Have My Attention
description: Wait, Gap's Pre–Black Friday Sale Is So Good—25 Elevated Winter Basics That Have My Attention
excerpt: Felicia Akerstrom wearing a herringbone coat
text: Since I can remember, Gap has been a part of my wardrobe. Reason being its basics never disappoint. This season is no different, other than the fact that the basics feel more elevated than ever. Now through November 24, you can get up to 60% off selected pieces that are perfect for winter thanks to the Gap Pre–Black Friday Sale. I am most definitely taking advantage and stocking up on all my favorites of the moment.In fact, I rounded up my top picks to share with you below. I had quite a hard time narrowing down the selects since everything from the current sale is so incredibly covetable. The pieces that made the cut range from luxe-looking coats to cool jeans and chic sweaters. The dresses are also a standout. Keep scrolling to shop 25 elevated winter basics from the Gap holiday sale that have my attention. Gap Modern Rib Cropped Mockneck Shirt Perfect alone or layered. Gap Belted Double-Faced Wool Scarf Coat I'm obsessed with this coat. Gap High Rise ’90s Straight Jeans Gap Oversized Split-Hem Mockneck Sweater I could live in this sweater. Gap Recycled Velvet Maxi Slip Dress Gap Cropped Pointelle Cardigan I want this in every color. Gap High Rise Barrel Jeans The It jeans of the moment. Nothing like a timeless trench coat. Gap Organic Cotton Big Shirt The contrasting cuffs are so chic. Gap Cashsoft Cable-Knit Sweater You know this must be so soft. Gap Cashsoft Rib Midi Polo Sweater Dress A cozy-chic little black dress. Camel accessories make any outfit look expensive. Gap High Rise Kick Fit Jeans Gap Cashsoft Turtleneck Sweater The whipstitch element makes this a standout. Gap Cashsoft Shaker-Stitch Mini Sweater Dress Gap 365 High Rise Cargo Pleated Trousers These trousers are a no-brainer. Gap Organic Cotton Poplin Big Shirt Gap Cashsoft Rib Maxi Sweater Skirt 'Tis the season for sweater-skirts. Gap Oversized Mixed Cable-Knit Sweater I never met a cable-knit I didn't like. Very into this textured outerwear. Gap High Rise Cuffed '90s Straight Jeans Gap Cashsoft Cable-Knit Sweater Pants Another pair of standout sweater-pants. Effortless skirts for the win. Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
html:
Since I can remember, Gap has been a part of my wardrobe. Reason being its basics never disappoint. This season is no different, other than the fact that the basics feel more elevated than ever. Now through November 24, you can get up to 60% off selected pieces that are perfect for winter thanks to the Gap Pre–Black Friday Sale. I am most definitely taking advantage and stocking up on all my favorites of the moment.

In fact, I rounded up my top picks to share with you below. I had quite a hard time narrowing down the selects since everything from the current sale is so incredibly covetable. The pieces that made the cut range from luxe-looking coats to cool jeans and chic sweaters. The dresses are also a standout. Keep scrolling to shop 25 elevated winter basics from the Gap holiday sale that have my attention.

Gap

Modern Rib Cropped Mockneck Shirt

Perfect alone or layered.

Gap

Belted Double-Faced Wool Scarf Coat

I'm obsessed with this coat.

Gap

High Rise ’90s Straight Jeans

Gap

Oversized Split-Hem Mockneck Sweater

I could live in this sweater.

Gap

Gap

Cropped Pointelle Cardigan

I want this in every color.

Gap

High Rise Barrel Jeans

The It jeans of the moment.

Nothing like a timeless trench coat.

Gap

The contrasting cuffs are so chic.

Gap

Cashsoft Cable-Knit Sweater

You know this must be so soft.

Gap

Cashsoft Rib Midi Polo Sweater Dress

A cozy-chic little black dress.

Camel accessories make any outfit look expensive.

Gap

High Rise Kick Fit Jeans

Gap

Cashsoft Turtleneck Sweater

The whipstitch element makes this a standout.

Gap

Cashsoft Shaker-Stitch Mini Sweater Dress

Gap

365 High Rise Cargo Pleated Trousers

These trousers are a no-brainer.

Gap

Organic Cotton Poplin Big Shirt

Gap

Cashsoft Rib Maxi Sweater Skirt

'Tis the season for sweater-skirts.

Gap

Oversized Mixed Cable-Knit Sweater

I never met a cable-knit I didn't like.

Very into this textured outerwear.

Gap

High Rise Cuffed '90s Straight Jeans

Gap

Cashsoft Cable-Knit Sweater Pants

Another pair of standout sweater-pants.

Effortless skirts for the win.

Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
